author: Special Correspondent
text:
Around 18,000 doctors in government service, including postgraduates have proposed to go on strike from Tuesday. The Service Doctors and Post Graduates Association held its State executive committee meeting on Sunday at the Madras Medical College listing out their demands.

“Our demands include implementing the Seventh Pay Commission recommendations besides providing the child care leave,” said P. Saminathan, association general secretary. “It had been stipulated in the last Pay Commission that women doctors who are in government service would be permitted to avail themselves of two years’ leave for child care. This entitles them to the leave anytime till the child attains 18 years of age. A woman doctor could take leave if her child falls sick or is taking exams,” he explained.

The doctors want the government to continue the old pension scheme instead of the new contributory pension scheme. They also want the government to create a corpus fund for their benefit. “The government could collect a certain amount from us every month which could benefit the family of a doctor in government service in case of his or her demise.

Meeting

The association will hold a district-wise meeting on Monday and will start wearing their ‘demand badge’ from Tuesday. On Friday a demonstration will be held in front of the Memorial Hall opposite MMC, the association said.

title: Service doctors plan protest
